comments:
Eclipse 3.0 M5 fail to synchronuze project on objectweb.org CVS with the 
message: An error occurred refreshing {0}: {1}/asm14An error has occurred 
processing file '/cvsroot/asm/build.properties 1.10'

Here is the connection parameters

cvs -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.asm.forge.objectweb.org:/cvsroot/asm login 
cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.asm.forge.objectweb.org:/cvsroot/asm co .

When prompted for a password for anonymous, simply press the Enter key. 

Here is the Eclipse stack trace:

Sorry, I can't access this server as I am behind a firewall at the moment. Do 
you have compression enabled. If so, could you please disable it and let me 
know if the error still occurs?

It is disabled on the client. I can't disable compression on the server.

By the way, the strange thing with objectweb.org is that I can see more files
from command line then Eclipse shows in the repository view and synchronize.

I think this is bug is a symptom of bug 47427. Eclipse does not support files 
in the root of a repository and doesn't support checking out the reposiory 
root as a project.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 47427 ***

I dont think that this bug is duplicate. I have the same problem if I chose
"src" directory as my module and connect it to the "src" directory in the
Eclipse project.

The strange thing is that even if I choose "src" module Eclipse is still
complaining about files at the root of the repository.

What do you mean by "connect"? There is no such operation in Eclipse. Could 
you provide the exact steps you took to arrive at the error so we can try to 
reproduce it. Thanks.

Sorry, for the unclear definition. The sequence as the following:

-- CVS Repositories view
-- Select repository and "src" folder in the default module.
-- Chose "Check Out As..." in the popup menu
-- Select "Check out into an existing project"
-- Select project folder and push "Finish"

Another option will be to use command line CVS client to checkout code from "."
module from CVS, then create .project and .classpath files, import such project
into Eclipse and then use "Team -> Share" to enable project synchronization.

I did the above steps, checking out into an empty project, and had no problem. 
Was the project you checked out into an existing project that was already 
mapped to CVS?

Based on my testing, I am convince this is a duplicate.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 47427 ***
